intro: Rytidosperma robertsoniae, commonly known as the Robertson's grass, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the grass family Poaceae and is characterized by its tufted growth habit and narrow, linear leaves. The plant produces small, spikelet-based inflorescences that are typically green or brown in color. It is often found in open habitats such as grasslands and rocky outcrops. Rytidosperma robertsoniae is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments, exhibiting drought tolerance and efficient water use.
